title: Table 1: % Children enrolled in different types of schools. By age group and sex. 2024
description: This table presents the 2024 school enrollment data for Gujarat, categorized by age groups (6-14, 7-16, 7-10, 11-14, 15-16) and gender. It details the percentage of children attending government, private, and other schools, as well as the percentage of children not currently enrolled.
data: | Age group and sex | Govt | Pvt | Other | Not in school | Total |

title: Table 2: % Children enrolled in different types of pre-schools and schools. By age. 2022
description: Enrollment statistics for children aged 3 to 8 in Gujarat for the year 2022. The data distinguishes between pre-school types (Anganwadi, Government pre-primary, Private LKG/UKG) and formal schooling, along with the percentage of children not enrolled in any institution.
data: | Age | Pre-school | Pre-school | Pre-school | School | School | School | Not in pre-school or school | Total |
| Age | Angan-wadi | Govt pre-primary | Pvt LKG/UKG | Govt | Pvt | Other | Not in pre-school or school | Total |

title: Table 3: % Children enrolled in different types of pre-schools and schools. By age. 2024
description: Enrollment statistics for children aged 3 to 8 in Gujarat for the year 2024. This table allows for comparison with 2022 data, detailing enrollment in Anganwadis, government and private pre-schools, and formal schools.
data: | Age | Pre-school | Pre-school | Pre-school | School | School | School | Not in pre-school or school | Total |
| Age | Angan-wadi | Govt pre-primary | Pvt LKG/ UKG | Govt | Pvt | Other | Not in pre-school or school | Total |

title: Table 4: % Children by grade and reading level. All children. 2024
description: 2024 reading proficiency assessment for children in Gujarat, covering Grades I through VIII. It shows the percentage of students at various reading levels: 'Not even letter', 'Letter', 'Word', 'Std I level text', and 'Std II level text'.
data: | Std | Not even letter | Letter | Word | Std I level text | Std II level text | Total |

title: Table 5: Trends over time
description: Historical analysis (2014-2024) of reading skills for Standard III students in Gujarat. The table tracks the percentage of children capable of reading Standard II level text, broken down by government and private schools.
data: | Year | % Children in Std III who can read Std II level text | % Children in Std III who can read Std II level text | % Children in Std III who can read Std II level text |

title: Table 6: Trends over time
description: Longitudinal data from 2014 to 2024 showing the percentage of students in Standard V and Standard VIII in Gujarat who can read Standard II level text. The data is segmented by government and private school enrollment.
data: | Year | % Children in Std V who can read Std II level text | % Children in Std V who can read Std II level text | % Children in Std V who can read Std II level text | % Children in Std VIII who can read Std II level text | % Children in Std VIII who can read Std II level text | % Children in Std VIII who can read Std II level text |

title: Table 7: % Children by grade and arithmetic level. All children. 2024
description: 2024 numeracy data for Gujarat schools, detailing the arithmetic proficiency of students in Grades I-VIII. The table shows percentages for 'Not even 1-9', 'Number recognition (1-9 and 10-99)', 'Subtraction', and 'Division'.

title: Table 8: Trends over time
description: Trends from 2014 to 2024 tracking the ability of Standard III students in Gujarat to perform subtraction. The table provides a comparison between government and private schools.
data: | Year | % Children in Std III who can do at least subtraction | % Children in Std III who can do at least subtraction | % Children in Std III who can do at least subtraction |

title: Table 9: Trends over time
description: Historical trend analysis (2014-2024) of division skills among students in Standard V and Standard VIII in Gujarat, broken down by school type (Government vs. Private).
data: | Year | % Children in Std V who can do division | % Children in Std V who can do division | % Children in Std V who can do division | % Children in Std VIII who can do division | % Children in Std VIII who can do division | % Children in Std VIII who can do division |

title: Table 10: Smartphone availability and use. By age. 2024

title: Table 17: Trends over time

title: Table 20: Trends over time
description: Comprehensive infrastructure survey of Gujarat schools (2010-2024) covering trends in mid-day meals, drinking water availability, toilet facilities (general and girls'), libraries, electricity, and computer availability.
data: | Mid-day meal | Mid-day meal served in school on the day of visit | 96.2 | 94.1 | 82.6 | 98.6 |
| Mid-day meal | Kitchen/shed for cooking mid-day meal | 88.3 | 90.4 | 69.0 | 90.6 |
| Drinking water | No facility for drinking water | 14.2 | 6.4 | 18.5 | 8.7 |
| Drinking water | Facility but no drinking water available | 6.5 | 5.6 | 9.7 | 7.8 |
| Toilet | Facility but toilet not useable | 32.6 | 8.5 | 4.2 | 22.4 |
| Girls' toilet | No separate provision for girls' toilet | 12.7 | 2.6 | 1.1 | 1.9 |
| Girls' toilet | Separate provision but locked | 20.7 | 1.1 | 0.4 | 4.0 |
| Girls' toilet | Separate provision, unlocked but not useable | 16.7 | 8.8 | 4.3 | 18.5 |
| Girls' toilet | Separate provision, unlocked and useable | 49.9 | 87.4 | 94.2 | 75.6 |
| Library | Library but no books being used by children on the day of visit | 35.2 | 44.8 | 16.8 | 28.2 |
| Library | Library books being used by children on the day of visit | 48.5 | 40.5 | 72.3 | 55.4 |
| Electricity | Of schools with electricity connection, % schools with electricity available on the day of visit |  | 96.5 | 93.7 | 97.3 |
| Computer | No computer available for children to use | 47.8 | 33.1 | 38.6 | 25.4 |
| Computer | Computer available but not being used by children on the day of visit | 24.3 | 42.9 | 20.5 | 34.6 |
| Computer | Computer being used by children on the day of visit | 27.9 | 24.0 | 40.9 | 40.0 |
